channel.title: Git on Badran Elshenawy
channel.description: Recent content in Git on Badran Elshenawy

item.title: Version Control Series – Capstone: Mastering Git for Reproducible Research
item.description: Consolidate your Git knowledge with this capstone guide covering essential Git workflows, best practices, and key takeaways.

item.title: Version Control Series – Part 7: Git Diff & Log – Tracking Changes Like a Pro
item.description: Master git diff and git log to track changes efficiently and enhance your version control workflow.

item.title: Version Control Series – Part 6: Understanding .gitignore – Keeping Your Repo Clean
item.description: Learn how to effectively use .gitignore to keep your Git repositories clean and manageable.

item.title: Version Control Series – Part 5: Undoing Mistakes in Git
item.description: Learn how to undo mistakes in Git using reset, revert, and other rollback techniques.

item.title: Version Control Series – Part 4: GitHub & Collaboration
item.description: Learn how to collaborate effectively on GitHub using pull requests, forks, and branching workflows.

item.title: Version Control Series – Part 3: Branching & Merging in Git
item.description: Understand Git branching and merging to work confidently without disrupting your main codebase.

item.title: Version Control Series - Part 2: Essential Git Commands You Should Know
item.description: Learn essential Git commands like add, commit, push, and pull to start mastering version control in bioinformatics.

item.title: Version Control Series - Part 1: Why Every Bioinformatician Needs Git
item.description: Discover why Git is a game-changer for bioinformatics, providing version control, reproducibility, and seamless collaboration.
